content: materials 1 x 100g/425m tofutsies 3 5mm crochet hook tapestry needle to weave in loose ends gauge or gauge is not crucial to this garment this scarf is worked as a five petal flower which sprouts another and another until you have a long enough scarf tofutsies 50% superwash wool 25% soysilk 22 5% cotton and 2 5% chitin fiber shrimp and crab shells 3 chain slip_stitch into a circle step 1 into circle *1dc-5chains-1dc back into circle* repeat all around slip_stitch into first double_crochet 5 petals step 2 into each loop repeat *4dc-5ch-4dc* slip_stitch into 1st double_crochet step 3 *1 double_crochet into each previous double_crochet-7ch-1dc into each previous double_crochet repeat all around slip_stitch into 1st double_crochet step 4 *1 double_crochet into each previous double_crochet 4 double_crochet-5 chain-4 double_crochet into each 7 chain loop repeat all around slip_stitch into 1st double_crochet step 5 *1 double_crochet into each previous double_crochet 4 double_crochet-5 chain-4 double_crochet into 5 chain loop* repeat all around slip_stitch into 1st double_crochet first star completed begin second star *slip_stitch across the back of star to the centre of the first star ch4 3ch-into 2nd chain begin again with step 1* repeat this process star fish scarf for each star until you have a number of stars which will twist and twist and look fabulous make as many stars as you would like to complete the scarf by yazmina-michele de gaye intermediate crochet single stars will also make great pins brooches or to accessorize other garments
